title: Scituate’s Mike Macdonald has ‘evolved’ from his Red Sox fandom. He’s scheming to take down the Patriots.
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Seahawks head coach Mike Macdonald, originally from Massachusetts, is leading his team against the Patriots in the upcoming Super Bowl.
Macdonald, a former Patriots fan, has transitioned allegiance and now leads the Seahawks as a top NFL defensive team.
The Seahawks, under Macdonald, allowed the fewest points in the NFL this season, highlighting their strong defensive identity.

title: ‘Jeopardy!’ featured a Massachusetts colleges category. Can you run the table?
author: John Waller
bullets: Jeopardy!'s 'Tournament of Champions' featured a category on Massachusetts colleges, titled 'Schooling You in Massachusetts'.
The $1,200 clue about a Waltham university without a law school stumped all contestants; answer: 'What is Brandeis?'
Clues included notable colleges like Smith, Amherst, Northeastern, and Mount Holyoke, spanning various award values.

title: ‘May the best team win’: Tom Brady’s evasive answer regarding his Super Bowl LX rooting interest
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Tom Brady offered an evasive answer about his Super Bowl LX rooting interest, saying he supports people rather than specific teams.
Brady stated he doesn't have a favorite between the Patriots and Seahawks, expressing excitement for New England's new era under Mike Vrabel.
Despite speculation, Brady dismissed claims he's rooting against the Patriots, highlighting his appreciation for past experiences and accomplishments.

title: Got an ice dam? Here’s what to do.
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Ice dams form on roof edges when melted snow refreezes, causing potential water damage to homes.
Preventing ice dams involves removing snow, improving attic insulation, and enhancing ventilation to reduce heat escape.
Experts recommend using a roof rake for snow removal and steaming for ice dam removal instead of salt.

title: Trump is said to have dropped demand for cash from Harvard
author: New York Times Service
bullets: Trump administration withdraws demand for $200 million from Harvard in educational control negotiations.
Trump now seeks $1 billion in damages, suggesting criminal investigations against Harvard.
Harvard relies heavily on federal funding, complicating potential agreements with the administration.

title: We can’t wait to watch these movies and TV shows in 2026
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Robert Pattinson and Zendaya star in 'The Drama', a film set in the Boston area, releasing on April 3.
'Paradise' Season 2 premieres on Hulu February 23, featuring Sterling K. Brown in a bunker drama.
Christopher Nolan's adaptation of 'The Odyssey', starring Matt Damon, releases July 17, continuing epic storytelling.

title: Report: Patriots owner Robert Kraft not selected for 2026 Pro Football Hall of Fame class
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Robert Kraft did not secure a spot in the 2026 Pro Football Hall of Fame class.
Kraft needed 40 votes out of 50 voters, but did not obtain the required 80% for selection.
Both Robert Kraft and Bill Belichick were finalists but did not make the 2026 Hall of Fame class.

title: Forget the refs. Bruins only have themselves to blame after collapse in Tampa.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Boston Bruins suffered a 6-5 shootout loss to the Tampa Bay Lightning after blowing a 5-1 lead.
Despite holding a significant lead, the Bruins accumulated numerous penalties, impacting their performance against Tampa Bay.
Coach Marco Sturm highlighted the need for discipline after the Bruins' missed opportunity in the Stadium Series matchup.

title: How NFL commissioner Roger Goodell reacted to reported Bill Belichick Hall of Fame snub
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Roger Goodell denied NFL involvement in Bill Belichick's Pro Football Hall of Fame voting results.
Belichick missed the Hall of Fame induction with less than the required 80% voting threshold for finalists.
Goodell praised Belichick's contributions, saying he and Robert Kraft deserve future Hall of Fame induction.

title: North Andover’s Jake Bobo ready to play ‘bad guy’ against hometown Patriots
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jake Bobo, Seattle Seahawks receiver, aims to prevent his hometown New England Patriots from winning their seventh Super Bowl.
Bobo, a North Andover native, expresses pride in his New England roots despite planning to play against the Patriots.
In his third season with Seattle, Bobo had a pivotal NFC championship game, catching a 17-yard touchdown against the Rams.
